newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: CRICKET-CAIRNS CRACKS NZ TO COMPETITIVE TOTAL VS ENGLAND.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-CAIRNS CRACKS NZ TO COMPETITIVE TOTAL VS ENGLAND.

text.p: A blazing 79 off 76 balls from all-rounder Chris Cairns carried New Zealand to 253 for eight in their second one-day cricket international against England at Eden Park on Sunday.
Cairns, playing as a batsman because of a persistent ankle injury, clubbed three sixes and five fours before being run out.

He added 42 with Stephen Fleming and 51 in 76 balls with Chris Harris to help push New Zealand to a competitive total after they had won the toss and elected on to bat first in hot, sticky conditions.
Opener Bryan Young got the innings off to a brisk start with 46 in 59 balls but both Fleming and Harris struggled to maintain the momentum.

The innings ended with a flourish as Dipak Patel and Gavin Larsen cracked 34 in 13 minutes off 22 balls, Patel lifting fast-medium Dominic Cork into the crowd over long on in making 24 off as many balls.
England's bowlers were wayward for much of the innings, bowling 16 wides, with Alan Mullally and Andrew Caddick -- who bowled four of his five in one over -- being the worst offenders.
Medium pacer Ronnie Irani, in a rare tour appearance, and offspinner Robert Croft were the tidiest of the England bowlers.
England were helped by three run outs, the most decisive being Cork's follow through off his own bowling to dismiss Cairns.
Irani's smart piece of work ran out Adam Parore, who was sent back attempting a short single, while Caddick's accurate throw from long on just beat Patel home off the final ball of the innings.
England will need a shade over five runs an over to win and take a 2-0 lead in the five-match series.
